basic.floral_language:
Sedum rubrotinctum 
Floriography: lovely, beautiful, warm
Sedum rubrotinctum has green, thick, fleshy, obovate leaves with a smooth surface. Leaf colors change to red with a great diurnal temperature range and abundant sunlight. For its small and exquisite appearance, widely favored by the public.
Sedum rubrotinctum likes strong sunlight, but enter a semi-dormant period in summer and need be placed under scattered light. Sometimes blooms with pale orange flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, flowers during spring, light orange flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, with adequate sunlight, leaves turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: A short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care, spring and autumn are its growing seasons, need plenty of sunshine
maintenance.watering: Water 2 times during summer dormancy, 20ml water every time, keep soil moist in other time, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once monthly in spring and autumn, do not apply in other seasons
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
